availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Charlotte VanderSyppe VanderEspt (Louisville, Ky, resident, wife of Belgian vice consul)

body.p: Louisville, Kentucky, resident. Native of Ghent, Belgium. Married to Charles J. VanderEspt in Nelson County, Kentucky, on December 31, 1860. Mother of Annie VanderEspt and Walter VanderEspt. Emigrated to the United States in 1853. Resident of Louisville in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Jefferson County, Louisville Ward 2, p. 499.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Jefferson County, Louisville Ward 5, p. 498A.
Kentucky Marriage Records, 1783-1965, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Nelson County Marriages, 1839-1888, Film #000500448, p. 406 of 603 of microfilm (accessed via Ancestry.com).
"Death of Mrs. Vanderespt," Courier-Journal (Louisville, Ky.), July 20, 1892, p. 2.
